Contracts Finder > Data feeds

Data feeds and downloadable reports

There are several ways to access Contracts Finder data: You can download weekly activity reports, subscribe to RSS feeds, or access recent and historic data in XML or Comma Separated Values (CSV) formats.

You can also download the Contracts Finder data feed developer guide (PDF).

Terms and conditions apply to the use of this data. See the bottom of this page for details

Activity summary and buyer group list

You can download a report giving a high-level view of procurement activity for all government departments and agencies that have published notices. It shows the total number of tender document summaries, contract document summaries and live opportunities published so far by each organisation.

A list of buyer groups registered on Contracts Finder is also available.

Both documents are updated weekly. They are in CSV format which can be opened as a spreadsheet or a simple text file.

MIS_EXT_NOTICE_SUM_01
MIS_EXT_BUYER_LIST_01


RSS feeds
You can subscribe to the following Contracts Finder RSS feeds. The feeds contain data for the past 90 days. They are updated every hour, and can be viewed in your web browser or news reader. Read an introduction to RSS feeds (external link).
Live opportunities Published tender and contract documentation for the government transparency commitment
All public sector below OJEU threshold contracts and notices All private sector sub contract opportunities, contracts and notices


Detailed reports - recent notices

Detailed contract information is available in XML and CSV formats. These are updated every night and contain data for the 40 days prior to today’s date.

The CSV version includes - for each notice - its title and brief description, the name of the buying organisation and the contract value. The machine-readable XML document contains additional data for each notice, including CPV codes.

Detailed report - recent notices (XML)
Detailed report - recent notices (CSV)


Detailed reports - older notices

Each month a snapshot is taken of the recent notices, and published in the list below.  They are in XML and CSV format and contain the information in the same form as the recent notices data.

Feb-2012 Feb-2012
Jan-2012 Jan-2012
Dec-2011 Dec-2011
Nov-2011 Nov-2011
Feb-2011 Feb-2011
Jan-2011 Jan-2011


Terms and conditions

The data published is Crown copyright unless it is marked as third party copyright.  Where the data is Crown copyright it will be assumed to be available under the terms of the Open Government Licence (OGL) unless it is marked as either:

  • Value added material
  • Material licensed by a Crown organisation under a delegation from the Controller of HM Stationery Office (HMSO)  

You can use Crown Copyright data available under the OGL in your own information applications so long as you comply with the standard OGL terms and conditions. If the Crown copyright data is not available under the OGL you must comply with the licence terms and condition which are identified as being applicable to that data.

If the data published is marked as third party copyright you have no right to copy or reuse that data without first seeking permission from the copyright owner.

OGL terms and conditions (National Archives website)
